title: How to Cook Lemon Pepper Pork Chops

steps.headline: Lay the pork chops out on a large sheet of aluminum foil.
steps.description: Using the juice of about half a lemon, liberally cover each pork chop.

steps.headline: Grind on plenty of fresh pepper.
Add salt and, if using, a small sprinkling of Accent (MSG).
steps.description: Turn the chops over and repeat.

steps.headline: Stack the pork chops in center of the foil, wrap them up, and put the package in fridge.
steps.description: Allow them to marinate for an hour or two.

steps.headline: Get a grill or other heating apparatus.
steps.description: A charcoal grill is the best option for this recipe, so spread some coals in the grill and light them up.

steps.headline: Don't start cooking until all of the flames have died down for at least a few minutes.
steps.description: Turn the chops often, look for hot spots, and douse liberally with fresh lemon juice and pepper each time you turn the chops.

steps.description: Don't worry about using too much lemon juice––it improves the flavor and moisture content.

steps.headline: Cook quickly to keep the inside juicy and remove as soon as they are done.

text: Lay the pork chops out on a large sheet of aluminum foil. Using the juice of about half a lemon, liberally cover each pork chop. Grind on plenty of fresh pepper.  Add salt and, if using, a small sprinkling of Accent (MSG). Turn the chops over and repeat. Stack the pork chops in center of the foil, wrap them up, and put the package in fridge. Allow them to marinate for an hour or two. Get a grill or other heating apparatus. A charcoal grill is the best option for this recipe, so spread some coals in the grill and light them up. Don't start cooking until all of the flames have died down for at least a few minutes. Turn the chops often, look for hot spots, and douse liberally with fresh lemon juice and pepper each time you turn the chops. Be generous with the lemon. Don't worry about using too much lemon juice––it improves the flavor and moisture content. Cook quickly to keep the inside juicy and remove as soon as they are done.  Enjoy!
